lines:
3 April, 1909.

1956

Dr. King Yên Kwan,

Plantain, China. 
My dear Dr. Karin

I onologo herewith a raport of your boy's work for the past teren. In 
is a pleasure to command the excellent spirit and generally gond vonults vinden 
have sharactørized your son's efforts here in And over. As I have written you 
before, we have taken a good deal n* pride in the fino records made by the major 
ity of the Chinese boys who have come to us in recent years, Ye 90% all agreed, 
however, that your boy is one of the most satisfantory members of the Andover 
Chinese delegation. He has tine natural ability, his spirit, has always teen 
most Gommendable, his faithfuiness and effort above reproach, and he has always 
conducted himselt with that inherent courtesy and reserve that mark the true 
gentleman. Personally I feel that the presence of a boy of this character in 
our midst is in itself a strong and helpful influence on our American boys, who 
in the mein lack the sourtesy and deforenee se characteristic of the older nas 
ting of the Kaste our instructors are all exceedingly tonå at sun sing, and 
are disposed to predict for him a successful and influential career.

Trusting that you may feel that the boy's work and progress here are all 
that could be desired, believe me, wat dina personal regards,

Very sincerely yours,

Principal,

In  is a pleasure to command the excellent spirit and generally gond vonults vinden  have sharactørized your son's efforts here in And over. As I have written you  before, we have taken a good deal n* pride in the fino records made by the major  ity of the Chinese boys who have come to us in recent years, Ye 90% all agreed,  however, that your boy is one of the most satisfantory members of the Andover  Chinese delegation. He has tine natural ability, his spirit, has always teen  most Gommendable, his faithfuiness and effort above reproach, and he has always  conducted himselt with that inherent courtesy and reserve that mark the true  gentleman. Personally I feel that the presence of a boy of this character in  our midst is in itself a strong and helpful influence on our American boys, who  in the mein lack the sourtesy and deforenee se characteristic of the older nas  ting of the Kaste our instructors are all exceedingly tonå at sun sing, and  are disposed to predict for him a successful and influential career.  Trusting that you may feel that the boy's work and progress here are all  that could be desired, believe me, wat dina personal regards,  Very sincerely yours,  Principal,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing a report on Sung Sing's school work. He commends his son for excellent work, fine natural ability, faithfulness and effort, and the courtesy of a true gentleman. Stearns states that the Chinese students have a strong positive influence on their American counterparts.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
